title: Northvolt raises $1.2bn and Northvolt Dwa produces first ESS
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Gdańsk, Poland, where Northvolt Dwa has assembled its first energy storage system (ESS) products as part of its commissioning process. 

Capacity:
- The new 25,000 square meter plant in Gdańsk assembles cells into battery systems for customers in energy storage and industrial markets. The capacity of the plant is not explicitly mentioned.

Investment amounts:
- Northvolt has raised $1.2 billion in an extension of a $1.1 billion convertible note, attracting investment from funds labeled dark green in accordance with Article 9 of the EU's Sustainable Finance Disclosure Regulation. The company has secured over $9 billion in equity and debt to deliver on over $55 billion in orders from key customers.

Project progress:
- Northvolt Dwa has assembled its first energy storage system (ESS) products in Gdańsk, Poland, as part of its commissioning process. The company has also built a new plant and is concluding the final validation of production lines. Customer deliveries are expected to commence later in the year.

Project type:
- The project involves the construction of a new plant in Gdańsk, Poland, to assemble cells into battery systems for energy storage and industrial markets.

Value chain stages:
- The facility covers the stages of cell fabrication, where cells are assembled into battery systems for customers in energy storage and industrial markets. The specific stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, as well as module assembly, are not mentioned.

title: NORTHVOLT ETT -LARGE SCALE BATTERY PLANT
notes:
Location
- The project is located in Skellefteå, Sweden.

Capacity
- The planned capacity of the lithium-ion battery cell manufacturing facility is 16 GWh, structured into two components, each with a manufacturing capacity of 8 GWh.

Investment amounts
- The proposed EIB finance is approximately EUR 400 million, with a total cost of approximately EUR 1522 million. The project has been structured to benefit from low-cost renewable electricity and potentially locally sourced materials.

Project progress
- The project is currently under appraisal as of 15/06/2018.

Project type
- The project involves the design, construction, commissioning, and operation of a new lithium-ion battery cell manufacturing facility.

Value chain stages
- The facility will cover the manufacturing of lithium-ion electrodes, cells, and batteries, falling under the Environmental Impact Assessment Directive 2014/52/EU.

title: Northvolt's battery factory to be built in Skellefteå
notes:
Location:
- The battery production plant is planned to be located in Skellefteå, Sweden.

Capacity:
- The factory is expected to have a total capacity of 32 GWh of battery production per year when fully built in 2023.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- The intention is to commence construction in the second half of 2018, with the first quarter of the plant expected to be completed and in production by 2020. The project is anticipated to be fully operational by 2023.

Project type:
- New build

Value chain stages:
- N/A

title: Northvolt To Step Up Battery Cell Output With $2.75 Billion Equity Round
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Skellefteå, Northern Sweden.

Capacity:
- The project's capacity is planned to increase from 40 to 60 GWh a year, enabling the production of enough batteries for 1 million electric vehicles annually.

Investment amounts:
- An additional $2.75 billion equity fund raising has been agreed upon to increase the production capacity. The total raised by the Swedish startup is over $6.5 billion. The project has received investments from Swedish pension funds, OMERS Capital Markets, Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Volkswagen Group, and other institutional investors.

Project progress:
- The gigafactory, named Northvolt Ett, has been under construction since Summer 2018 and is expected to start production later this year. Production is anticipated to ramp up gradually over the next 3 - 5 years.

Project type:
- The project is a new build gigafactory.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will be capable of recycling lithium, cobalt, nickel, manganese, and other metals, covering the value chain stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

title: From start-up to scale-up: Europe’s first homegrown gigafactory
notes:
Location: Europe, specific country and area not mentioned.

Capacity: N/A

Investment amounts: The European Investment Bank provided a series of loans backed by the EU’s InnovFin innovation-support facility and the Investment Plan for Europe to finance the company’s demo plant. Private sector banks and long-term investors also contributed after customers began placing orders.

Project progress: The project began with the European Investment Bank financing the company’s demo plant, followed by customer orders and subsequent investment from private sector banks and long-term investors.

title: Battery venture could transform sub-Arctic Sweden
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in Skellefteå, Sweden.

Capacity:
- The factory is expected to produce 8 GWh of batteries annually by 2020, with a planned increase to 32 GWh by 2023.

Investment amounts:
- The European Investment Bank has committed €350 million in loans to Northvolt.
- Volkswagen has agreed to invest €900 million in Northvolt, securing a 20 percent stake and a seat on the board.

Project progress:
- The project is currently in the construction phase, with the factory being built in a massive clearing in the woods near the town center.
- The European Investment Bank recently approved a loan in May, and Volkswagen has agreed to invest in the project.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the factory being constructed from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Note: The article provides detailed information about the Northvolt battery production project in Skellefteå, Sweden, including the investment, capacity, and progress of the project.
